00:00:03:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:03:150000.Dialogue: All I'm saying is, if they took all the money they spent trying to make a decent Hulk movie, they could probably just make an actual Hulk.

00:00:10:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:10:150000.Dialogue: That is apt and amusing. I think I shall share that with Amy Farrah Fowler. She'll appreciate the witticism.

00:00:20:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:20:060000.Dialogue: It'll also help improve her initial impression of you.

00:00:23:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:23:160000.Dialogue: So what's going on with you two?

00:00:26:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:26:080000.Dialogue: Well, the status is as it always was. She's a girl. She's a friend. She is not my-- please forgive me for doing this-- girlfriend.

00:00:35:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:35:040000.Dialogue: Right, right. So you're still just texting and emailing? You don't feel any need to hang out with her, you know-- be in the same room?

00:00:44:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:44:090000.Dialogue: Leonard, you are my best friend. I've known you for seven years, and I can barely tolerate sitting on the couch with you. Imagine my attitude regarding prolonged physical proximity to Amy Farrah Fowler.

00:00:58:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:58:210000.Dialogue: I sense judgment on your part.

00:01:05:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:05:150000.Dialogue: May I suggest that your criticism is based on jealousy.

00:01:09:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:09:190000.Dialogue: Jealousy? What do I have to be jealous of?

00:01:12:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:12:140000.Dialogue: I have a functioning and satisfying relationship with a female.

00:01:22:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:22:210000.Dialogue: Jealousy is an ugly green-eyed monster-- not unlike the Hulk-- who, by the way, also has a girlfriend. In this iteration, Jennifer Connelly, whom you may recall as the girlfriend of Russell Crowe in A Beautiful Mind, a feel-good romp if there ever was one.

00:02:12:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:12:140000.Dialogue: You know, it just occurred to me, if there are an infinite number of parallel universes, in one of them, there's probably a Sheldon who doesn't believe parallel universes exist.

00:02:26:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:26:130000.Dialogue: No point. It's just one of the things that makes one of the mes chuckle. What makes you chuckle, Leonard?

00:02:38:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:38:150000.Dialogue: Is it because of the conflict that arises from your desperate need to pair-bond with a woman, and the apparent collective decision of all womankind to deny you that opportunity?

00:02:53:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:53:140000.Dialogue: SHELDON: You know, when my grandfather died, and Meemaw was alone, my mom arranged for her to visit a center three times a week where she could socialize with other lonely people. It's very nice. They discuss current events, play bridge, get a hot meal.

00:03:10:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:10:080000.Dialogue: It is if you like bridge. Do you like bridge, Leonard?

00:03:15:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:15:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm just not dating someone right now. I don't need to go to a senior center.

00:03:22:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:22:170000.Dialogue: Meemaw resisted at first, but now she loves it.

00:03:26:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:26:200000.Dialogue: Fine. If I don't meet someone soon, you can put me in a home.

00:03:30:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:30:080000.Dialogue: It's not a home. It's a senior center. We'd never put Meemaw in a home!

00:03:40:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:40:150000.Dialogue: All right, I'll bow to social pressure: Hey!

00:03:46:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:46:050000.Dialogue: Excuse me. That's my girlfriend, Bernadette. I assigned her her own ringtone-- Bernadette, by The Four Tops. Hello, Bernadette.

00:03:54:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:54:050000.Dialogue: When I call him, his phone plays "Brown Eyed Girl."

00:03:58:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:58:120000.Dialogue: Which, now that I think about it, is not so good.

00:04:01:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:01:190000.Dialogue: You realize he's just rubbing our noses in the fact that he has a girlfriend, and we don't.

00:04:08:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:08:050000.Dialogue: You have a girlfriend? How could you have a girlfriend? You can't even speak to women.

00:04:16:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:16:100000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter if I can't talk, because she can't hear me.

00:04:24:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:24:200000.Dialogue: Great. You have a girlfriend, Howard's got a girlfriend, Sheldon's got a girl...

00:04:31:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:31:220000.Dialogue: What about you, Stuart? You have a girlfriend yet?

00:04:34:140000.Speaker: Stuart
00:04:34:140000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Yeah. I met her at Comic-Con, the one place in the world where saying I own a comic bookstore is an actual pickup line.

00:04:47:050000.Speaker: Stuart
00:04:47:050000.Dialogue: When she wants to have sex, she puts on her plus-size Wonder Woman costume and shouts, Who wants to take a ride

00:04:55:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:55:070000.Dialogue: Why don't you just break up with her?

00:05:00:230000.Speaker: Stuart
00:05:00:230000.Dialogue: Cause then I'd be alone, like you.

00:05:05:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:05:020000.Dialogue: Dude, why don't you just invoke your girlfriend pact with Wolowitz?

00:05:09:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:09:020000.Dialogue: Because I don't need his girlfriend to set me up with one of her girlfriends. I'm perfectly capable of finding a girl on my own.

00:05:17:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:17:020000.Dialogue: Oh, Leonard, you remind me of the funny old story about a man who walks into a women's correctional institution with a stack of paperwork that will allow the female convicts to go free.

00:05:27:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:27:040000.Dialogue: You're saying I couldn't get laid in a women's prison with a handful of pardons.

00:05:32:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:32:150000.Dialogue: Are you going to let me tell the story or not?

00:05:38:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:38:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:41:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:41:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:43:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:43:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:44:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:44:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:45:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:45:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:45:030000.Dialogue: Are you still depressed because you're alone, and no one loves you?

00:05:48:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:48:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:51:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:51:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:51:070000.Dialogue: I want you to know that I'm genuinely concerned about your well-being.

00:05:54:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:05:54:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:01:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:01:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:01:170000.Dialogue: AMY: May I offer an observation?

00:06:07:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:07:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:07:030000.Dialogue: What the hell? How long has she been here?

00:06:08:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:08:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:08:210000.Dialogue: Since we got home from the comic bookstore.

00:06:11:160000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:11:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:12:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:12:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:12:190000.Dialogue: As per your suggestion, we're hanging out. Quite frankly, I don't see what all the hoopla's about. Go on, Amy.

00:06:19:120000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:19:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:19:120000.Dialogue: From a neurobiological standpoint, Leonard, you may be alone because your psychological state is causing an actual pheromone-based stink of desperation.

00:06:28:220000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:28:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:30:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:30:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:33:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:33:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:33:080000.Dialogue: I understand that some people find mates in social gathering places such as bars or taverns. Have you tried a bar or tavern?

00:06:39:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:39:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:39:140000.Dialogue: No, I'm not gonna try to pick up a woman in a bar.

00:06:41:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:06:41:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:41:210000.Dialogue: Wise decision. You see, Amy, success at a bar is based on classic male attributes such as height, strength, attractiveness, the ability to hold one's liquor and throw darts-- separately or together. Leonard has none of these attributes, right, Leonard?

00:07:00:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:00:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:02:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:02:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:02:230000.Dialogue: That's not true of all bars. Juice bars, for example.

00:07:05:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:05:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:05:190000.Dialogue: Oh! Good point, Amy. Yeah, building on your premise, Leonard could frequent sushi bars, salad bars, oyster bars, the Apple Genius Bar... What are you doing?

00:07:16:090000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:16:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:19:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:19:080000.Speaker: Amy

00:07:21:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:21:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:21:070000.Dialogue: He does it all the time. He's a cornucopia of social awkwardness.

00:07:27:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:27:040000.Speaker: Amy

00:07:29:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:29:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:29:130000.Dialogue: Let's make that our word of the day.

00:07:31:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:31:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:31:100000.Dialogue: Agreed. And we'll use mellifluous tomorrow.

00:07:34:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:34:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:34:140000.Dialogue: Well, I have to void my bladder. It was nice spending this time with you.

00:07:39:160000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:39:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:39:160000.Dialogue: AMY: Wait. I have a request.

00:07:42:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:42:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:43:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:43:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:43:110000.Dialogue: I'd like you to meet my mother.

00:07:44:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:44:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:44:210000.Dialogue: I see. Can I get back to you on that?

00:07:47:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:47:200000.Speaker: Amy

00:07:49:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:49:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:55:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:07:55:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:55:140000.Dialogue: Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard...

00:08:06:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:06:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:08:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:08:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:08:060000.Dialogue: Amy Farrah Fowler has asked me to meet her mother.

00:08:11:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:11:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:12:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:12:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:15:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:15:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:15:030000.Dialogue: Well, you know how you're always saying that Amy is a girl who's your friend, and not your girlfriend?

00:08:20:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:20:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:20:110000.Dialogue: Uh-huh. You can't say that anymore.

00:08:25:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:25:080000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:27:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:27:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:27:080000.Dialogue: Look, she obviously wants to take your relationship to the next level.

00:08:30:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:30:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:30:190000.Dialogue: I don't want the next level. I like this level. Fix it for me!

00:08:36:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:36:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:36:030000.Dialogue: Me? Well, how am I supposed to fix it?

00:08:39:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:39:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:39:170000.Dialogue: Simple! You want a girlfriend, Amy wants to be someone's girlfriend. Take her off my hands. I give you my blessing.

00:08:46:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:46:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:48:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:48:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:48:060000.Dialogue: You're right. It would never work. Amy finds you tedious.

00:08:51:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:51:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:53:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:53:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:53:050000.Dialogue: Wait! What am I supposed to do?

00:08:55:090000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:55:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:55:090000.Dialogue: Well, have you considered telling her how you feel?

00:08:58:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:08:58:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:58:040000.Dialogue: Leonard, I'm a physicist, not a hippie.

00:09:03:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:09:03:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:03:020000.Dialogue: All right, well, let me see if I can explain your situation using physics. What would you be if you were attached to another object by an inclined plane wrapped helically around an axis?

00:09:14:220000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:09:14:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:19:090000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
00:09:19:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:24:050000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:24:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:31:220000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:31:220000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:09:31:220000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Howard, get the door!

00:09:36:140000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:36:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:36:140000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Why can't you get it?

00:09:38:130000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:38:130000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:09:38:130000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: You know I'm doing a bowel cleanse for my colonoscopy!

00:09:44:170000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:44:170000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:09:44:170000.Dialogue: I'm like an upside-down volcano here.

00:09:50:160000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:50:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:50:160000.Dialogue: Oh, hey. I hope you didn't hear that.

00:09:54:100000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:54:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:56:130000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:09:56:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:56:130000.Dialogue: What's with the T-shirt? You working at the Apple store now?

00:10:00:100000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:00:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:00:100000.Dialogue: No, it's just something I threw on.

00:10:02:160000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:02:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:02:160000.Dialogue: I know all your shirts. That's not one of them... You were pretending to work at the Genius Bar to pick up women, weren't you?

00:10:09:120000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:09:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:13:120000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:13:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:13:120000.Dialogue: Turns out, they guard the iPods, but they don't guard the shirts.

00:10:17:090000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:17:090000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:19:010000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:19:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:19:010000.Dialogue: It was going well. I was showing this super hot girl how to boot up in Safe Mode. The manager got suspicious, and, well, long story short, they really do have a little jail in the mall.

00:10:30:160000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:30:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:30:160000.Dialogue: Just FYI, don't try to go back with a fake mustache. I mean, they may not really be geniuses, but they see right through that.

00:10:38:140000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:38:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:38:140000.Dialogue: I want to invoke the girlfriend pact, Howard.

00:10:41:120000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:41:120000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:42:170000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:42:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:42:170000.Dialogue: No, I just... I want what you have. You know, I want a woman in my life.

00:10:47:030000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:47:030000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:10:47:030000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Holy Moses, how much liquid can be in one tokus?

00:10:55:000000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:55:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:55:000000.Dialogue: To be clear, I meant like Bernadette, not your mother.

00:10:58:060000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
00:10:58:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:58:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, I know what you mean.

00:11:05:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:05:020000.Dialogue: Well, I'm off to meet Bernadette's friend. How do I look?

00:11:09:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:09:090000.Dialogue: As if one of the plants from Invasion of the Body Snatchers duplicated you in every way, only with an absurd amount of hair gel.

00:11:19:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:19:040000.Dialogue: I'm removing my digital footprint from the Internet so Amy Farrah Fowler can't find me and compel me to meet her mother.

00:11:24:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:24:050000.Dialogue: Ah. You're going off the grid.

00:11:32:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:32:160000.Dialogue: Thank you. I've also sent Amy a relationship termination notice and changed my cell phone number and e-mail address.

00:11:41:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:41:030000.Dialogue: What if she just comes over?

00:11:42:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:42:210000.Dialogue: She'll get lost. We no longer live at 2311 Los Robles. We now live at 311 Los Robles.

00:11:53:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:53:200000.Dialogue: You changed the address on the building? What about mail?

00:11:57:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:57:090000.Dialogue: Oh, no worries-- I explained my predicament to our letter carrier. He was sympathetic. His exact words were: "Got your back, Jack. Bitches be crazy."

00:12:23:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:23:230000.Dialogue: The only flaw in an otherwise perfect plan.

00:12:30:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:30:030000.Dialogue: What do you want to do?

00:13:03:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:03:140000.Dialogue: Way to go on the details.

00:13:07:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:07:210000.Dialogue: Thanks again for doing this, Bernadette.

00:13:10:120000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:10:120000.Dialogue: Oh, I take pacts very seriously. One time at my lab, a petri dish of genetically modified super-virus went missing. That day we made a pinky swear never to admit we crossed Ebola with the common cold.

00:13:22:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:22:140000.Dialogue: (chuckling): Why the hell would you cross Ebola with the common cold?

00:13:27:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:27:040000.Dialogue: We never did. That would be a terrible, terrible thing.

00:13:33:200000.Speaker: Girl
00:13:33:200000.Dialogue: Hi. Sorry I'm late-- I was at the gym. Spin class-- worked up quite a sweat.

00:13:42:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:42:060000.Dialogue: Joy, this is Leonard. Leonard, this is Joy.

00:13:51:230000.Speaker: Joy
00:13:51:230000.Dialogue: JOY: Just kidding. First thing you need to know about me: I'm hilarious.

00:13:58:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:58:090000.Dialogue: Yeah. LEONARD: So, Bernadette tells me she knows you from self-defense classes?

00:14:03:190000.Speaker: Joy
00:14:03:190000.Dialogue: Yeah. Israeli Krav Maga. Lots of fun. Basically, a hundred different ways to rip a guy's nuts off.

00:14:11:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:11:220000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Wow. Wouldn't think there'd be that many.

00:14:25:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:25:120000.Dialogue: (rhythmically): Proxima Centauri's the nearest star. The celestial bodies that follow are Alpha Centauri A, Toli, Barnard's Star, Wolf 359...

00:14:42:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:42:200000.Dialogue: Lalande 21185, Sirius A, Sirius B, BL-Ceti, UV-Ceti, Ross 154... Ross 248...

00:14:56:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:56:180000.Dialogue: Epsilon Eridani, Lac-9352, Ross 128, Procyon A... Oh, darn, that's wrong!

00:15:11:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:11:180000.Dialogue: EZ Aquarii A, EZ Aquarii B, EZ Aquarii C, Procyon A. Those are the stars that are nearest to me. Tra-la-la and fiddle-dee-dee.

00:15:43:220000.Speaker: Joy
00:15:43:220000.Dialogue: This lobster's good on the way down and the way up.

00:15:52:110000.Speaker: Joy
00:15:52:110000.Dialogue: Hey, this is a date, right?

00:16:00:200000.Speaker: Joy
00:16:00:200000.Dialogue: (clears throat) Excuse me, I have to go to the little girls' room... and take a wicked whiz.

00:16:08:060000.Speaker: Joy
00:16:08:060000.Dialogue: Fair warning-- I had the asparagus. My pea is gonna stink up the place.

00:16:20:130000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:16:20:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:20:130000.Dialogue: EZ Aquarii B... EZ Aquarii C...

00:16:33:080000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:16:33:080000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:36:230000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:16:36:230000.Speaker: Amy

00:16:38:050000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:16:38:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:40:130000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:16:40:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:40:130000.Dialogue: I believe a misunderstanding may have occurred when I asked you to meet my mother.

00:16:46:120000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:16:46:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:46:120000.Dialogue: No misunderstanding. I've learned what that request actually means, and I don't want to be joined to another object by an inclined plane wrapped helically around an axis.

00:16:56:220000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:16:56:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:56:220000.Dialogue: In what way are you screwed?

00:17:00:130000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:00:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:00:130000.Dialogue: All I want to do is present you as my boyfriend to my mother so she'll be satisfied that I'm in a relationship.

00:17:06:150000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:06:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:06:150000.Dialogue: So we'd be perpetrating a ruse?

00:17:08:190000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:08:190000.Speaker: Amy

00:17:10:060000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:10:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:10:060000.Dialogue: And you haven't fallen hopelessly in love with me?

00:17:13:210000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:13:210000.Speaker: Amy

00:17:16:190000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:16:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:16:190000.Dialogue: I find the notion of romantic love to be an unnecessary cultural construct that adds no value to human relationships.

00:17:22:140000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:22:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:22:140000.Dialogue: Amy Farrah Fowler, that's the most pragmatic thing anyone has ever said to me.

00:17:28:100000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:28:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:28:100000.Dialogue: I trust this clarification allows us to return to boy-slash-friend-slash- girl-slash-friend status.

00:17:34:020000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:34:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:34:020000.Dialogue: Of course. Would you like to join me for Chinese food?

00:17:38:010000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
00:17:38:010000.Speaker: Amy

00:17:48:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:48:050000.Dialogue: Come on, just give her a chance. Maybe she'll grow on you.

00:17:51:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:51:130000.Dialogue: Or maybe she'll finally succeed in ripping my nuts off.

00:17:56:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:56:220000.Dialogue: There are still 93 ways she hasn't tried yet. Look, H-Howard, I appreciate the effort, but this is, like, the worst date of my life.

00:18:04:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:04:230000.Dialogue: (laughs) Seriously? I was once robbed by a pre-op transsexual I met on J-Date, and that didn't even crack my top ten.

00:18:13:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:13:100000.Dialogue: I guess the difference is, I have some self-respect.

00:18:19:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:19:090000.Dialogue: It's relatively new. I just know that I'm not gonna spend time with someone I don't like simply to have a girlfriend. I'm okay on my own.

00:18:28:060000.Speaker: Joy
00:18:28:060000.Dialogue: Good news-- I made lots of room for dessert.

00:18:33:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:33:070000.Dialogue: Look, uh, Joy, it was nice to meet you, but...

00:18:36:030000.Speaker: Joy
00:18:36:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, you, too. Hey, you got anything for next weekend? I need a date for my cousin's wedding.

00:18:41:140000.Speaker: Joy
00:18:41:140000.Dialogue: JOY: Yeah. And it's an open bar, so I'll probably be giving it away.

00:18:57:230000.Speaker: Mrs Fowler
00:18:57:230000.Dialogue: MRS. FOWLER (on laptop): It's nice to meet you, too, Sheldon. I honestly didn't believe Amy when she told me she had a boyfriend.

00:19:05:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:05:070000.Dialogue: I assure you I am quite real and I'm having regular intercourse with your daughter.

00:19:14:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:14:040000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. We're like wild animals in heat. It's a wonder neither of us has been hurt.

00:19:24:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:24:210000.Dialogue: You wanted me to have a boyfriend, Mother. Well, here he is.

00:19:32:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:32:140000.Dialogue: Have to sign off now. My hunger for Sheldon is stirring in my loins.

00:19:38:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:38:050000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, it's time for me to make love to your daughter's vagina.

00:19:46:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:46:140000.Dialogue: Thank you, Sheldon, that went very well.

00:19:49:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:49:020000.Dialogue: Agreed. Amy, I find myself wondering if we should actually engage in coitus at least one time in our relationship. Bazinga.
